metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000872 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: OpenKMIP PyKMIP version All versions before 0.8.0 contains a CWE 399: Resource Management Errors (similar issue to CVE-2015-5262) vulnerability in PyKMIP server that can result in DOS: the server can be made unavailable by one or more clients opening all of the available sockets. This attack appear to be exploitable via A client or clients open sockets with the server and then never close them. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 0.8.0.

criterions.comment: python-pykmip: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
